Parse a Dataframe for Analysis

parse_function.Rd

Processes a dataframe to generate summaries for numeric, factor, character, binary, date, and other data types. Supports year-based summaries.

Usage

parse_function(
  parse_df,
  suffix_term = "",
  ind_outcomes = c(""),
  surg_col = "surgeon",
  add_years = FALSE
)

Arguments

parse_df

Dataframe. Input dataframe to parse and analyze.

suffix_term

Character. Suffix to append to parsed column names (default: "").

ind_outcomes

Character vector. Individual outcomes for parsing (default: "").

surg_col

Character. Column name representing surgeons (default: "surgeon").

add_years

Logical. Include year-based summaries in the output (default: FALSE).

Value

A list of dataframes summarizing the input dataset:

numeric_df

Numeric column summaries (e.g., mean, quartiles, NA percentages).

factor_df

Factor column summaries (e.g., unique levels, NA percentages).

char_df

Character column summaries (e.g., unique values, NA percentages).

binary_df

Binary column summaries (e.g., ratio of TRUE, NA percentages).

date_df

Date column summaries (e.g., min, max, NA percentages).

surg_df

Summaries by surgeon for specified outcomes.

years_mean

Yearly mean summaries if add_years = TRUE.

years_na

Yearly NA percentages if add_years = TRUE.

Examples

results <- parse_function(parse_df = my_data)
#> Error: object 'my_data' not found
results_with_years <- parse_function(parse_df = my_data, add_years = TRUE)
#> Error: object 'my_data' not found
results_with_outcomes <- parse_function(parse_df = my_data, ind_outcomes = c("outcome1"))
#> Error: object 'my_data' not found
